channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple Needs Time to Be on Its Side for AI iPhones
item.description: Wall Street is seeing moderate iPhone sales gains over the next two years, as AI features will roll out slowly.

item.title: One of the last China bulls has capitulated. What JPMorgan likes instead.
item.description: JPMorgan says it’s now neutral on Chinese equities.

item.title: Flooding Is Getting Worse---and Fewer Homeowners Have Insurance
item.description: Swaths of the U.S. that have never flooded before are now in danger of being swamped, but the risk isn’t covered by standard home-insurance policies.

item.title: ‘This flies in the face of my morals and ethics’: My father cut my sisters out of his six-figure estate. Should I push back?
item.description: “Although there is time for him to change his mind, my dad is a stubborn man.”

item.title: Affirm to Profit Soon From Buy Now, Pay Later
item.description: Lower interest rates and growing volume will be tailwinds.

item.title: ‘At times, the pain is unbearable’: My daughter cut me out of her life. I’m conflicted — do I exclude her from my will?
item.description: “I scrimped, saved, invested and worked multiple jobs my entire adult life so my children would never have to pay my senior-care medical expenses.”

item.title: Bank of America Bets on Carbon Capture With Big Tax-Credit Deal
item.description: A first-of-its-kind investment gives an ethanol producer in North Dakota $205 million for stashing emissions underground.

item.title: ‘Boy, that escalated quickly.’ Goldman strategist says stock market could fall further
item.description: Investors have already started working to protect themselves against the September slump, having accelerated their trading strategies in the wake of t...

item.title: The Crushing Financial Burden of Aging at Home
item.description: Families face soaring costs and mounting pressures in taking care of their loved ones. “I never feel truly free.”

item.title: My 62-year-old live-in girlfriend doesn’t save for retirement, and nothing I do will make her.
item.description: ‘Every time I mention it, she gets defensive and tells me it will work out.’
